channel.title: Match on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Comprehensive theme park spreading in the great nature of nature, Gwacheon, Gyeonggi - Korea Match
item.description:
Seoul Grand Park Entrance

Comprehensive theme park spreading in the great nature of nature, Gwacheon, Gyeonggi

Korea Match

<Total travel distance>
Seoul Grand Park Main Gate → 20 minutes on foot (Elephant Train or Sky Lift available) → Seoul Grand Park Zoo → 3 minutes on foot → Theme Garden (Children's Zoo) → 15 minutes on foot → Giraffe Country → Car 10 minutes 3km → National Gwacheon Science Museum → Car 10 Minute 3km → Let's Run Park Seoul
Gwacheon is the best family travel destination in Korea. Seoul Grand Park, the second largest national science museum in Asia, Let's Run Park is a fun weekend excursion, and a large-scale kids experience center, Giraffe Nara, is also gathered. Let's go to Gwacheon, a place that can be easily accessed by public transportation and is relatively inexpensive to enjoy with children.
Seoul Grand Park to interact with nature and make friends with animals
When you enter the Seoul Grand Park, you are excited about the spacious nature and relaxed gestures of the animals. The site area is about 9,157 km² (about 2.77 million pyeong), making it difficult to measure the scale at once. If you are away from the complex city center and blend natural greenery, you can spend a lot of time with children, from animals and plants to camping in the woods and visiting the Museum of Modern Art. However, the large size makes it easy for children to get tired quickly. In order not to overdo it, it is good to plan and move effectively.
Road to Skylift
Let's use Sky Lift, which gives a panoramic view of Seoul Grand Park. Walk about 5 minutes to the right of the ticket counter of the Grand Park and take the lift (about 13 minutes) to Line 1 towards the main entrance of the zoo. A cool breeze is coming when I try to cross the reservoir in the park. If you have a stroller, don't worry. Safety personnel put it on the front seat lift.
Skylift Unit 1 Boarding Locations and Ticket Offices
When taking the lift, it is better to use both sections until the lift of Line 2 (approximately 17 minutes) leading to the Tiger Farm, which is at the northern end of the Seoul Zoo. The total length is 1,710m, which takes about 30-40 minutes. It is efficient to come down from the top and watch the trail where the desired animals are.
Seoul Grand Park Theme Garden Rose Garden
Seoul Zoo unfolds animal stories from around the world. The zoo, where all kinds of animals from all over the world are gathered, lives in about 2,500 species of about 262 species, including the world's rarest species, the Roland Gorilla.
Siberian Tiger Tailbone in Raptor Temple
From popular animals such as lions, giraffes, and elephants from Africa, to herbivores from the grasslands and from birds flying from each continent.
Seoul Zoo Elephant
Children are particularly curious about elephants and giraffes.
Giraffe ecology briefing session
At the time of the zookeeper's ecological briefing, you can learn more about the ecology of animals you haven't known.
Feeding the zookeeper during the briefing session
The theme garden is located opposite the main entrance of the zoo.
Children's zoo in the theme garden
Let's see the children's zoo in the theme garden first. It is fun to have a fence tailored to children's eye level, feeding experience, and baby animals.
Feeding Experience (Children's Zoo)
At the children's zoo, marmosets, cotton-headed tamarins, meerkats, hedgehogs, and rabbits live. Roses are in full bloom in the Rose Garden in the theme garden every June.
Rose garden landscape
Around 30,000 roses of 400 species form a spectacular view around the lake of the Grand Park.
Rose garden landscape
Giraffe country, special experience from fitness training to emotional development

'Giraffe Country', located next to the Sky Lift in Seoul Grand Park, is a large kids experience center. It is not just a place with a lot of toys, but a place where children can experience with their own body, gain experience through various programs, and communicate with parents. Experience play on the 3rd floor is operated on time or every 30 minutes, so it is good to plan the play after checking the operating hours.

Draw in the shadow forest with a highlighter (giraffe country)

The first floor is an experience-oriented space. 'Shadow Forest', after watching a hand shadow performance, learns the properties of light by creating shadows for children themselves. When the lights are turned off, there is no hesitation in drawing with each highlighter. 'Mirror Maze' is an experience of looking at yourself while looking at yourself in the mirror. You may run into a blocked maze and bump into the mirror, so you need to be careful with your guardian to avoid running randomly.

Inside the mirror maze (giraffe country)
'Block Country' is also a good place for children to spend a long time focusing. You can make everything you want to make in a block world filled with all kinds of blocks.
Bull Climbing (Giraffe)
The Ball Pool Climbing Valley is the place where children play most, and both children and parents like it because it is a safe facility for rock climbing, slides, and throwing yourself into the ball pool.
Block country (giraffe country)
'Black Light Nanta Bang' is a space where children and adults can relax together.
Nanta Class (Black Light Nanta Room-Giraffe Country)
After learning how to catch drumsticks, tapping on the drums to meet various nursery rhymes, you'll be immersed in the show as if you were the main character in the performance.
Nanta Class (Black Light Nanta Room-Giraffe Country)
The second floor of the Kirin Country is reminiscent of a large kids cafe.
The infant and toddler zone on the 2nd floor (Giraffe country)
There are amusement facilities such as jungle gym, obstacle experience, rotating kitty, merry-go-round, swing, and infant zone for infants under 36 months.
Traffic Experience Center (Kirin Nara)
The third floor is the Kirin Gymnasium of the Kirin Country. The most popular place is by far the lawn sled. It is a place where you can sled all year round. At the request of the children, if the staff in charge rotates the sled, it can rotate 360 ° and taste the thrilling speed. Operate for 30 minutes every hour on time, so keep the time. You can drive your own car at the traffic experience area, but the children are having fun. There is a restaurant and a cafe on each floor, and there is a seating area, making it ideal for spending more than half a day with a child.
Grass Sledding Ground (Giraffe Country)
National Gwacheon Science Museum where infinite imagination unfolds
The National Gwacheon Science Museum has all the benefits, fun and fruitful facilities. It is Korea's largest and second-largest comprehensive science museum in Asia. You can forget about the hardness of the word 'science'. This is because for the infant and child family, an open outdoor space and a good exhibition hall facility can become a 'children's favorite place'.
National Gwacheon Science Museum
Before going to the permanent exhibition, let's take a look at the outdoor exhibition. You can experience exhibitions in nature that cannot be felt indoors. There are many things to see all over the place, including the dinosaur garden where 7 kinds of life-size dinosaur models are exhibited, the whole observation station, Mirai Railway 999, family creative playground, Saiart lounge, and ecological park.
Stegosaurus model in outdoor exhibition hall
At the playground of the Science Museum, children learn science without their knowledge. It is to become acquainted with science through experience and experience rather than learning a grand science theory.
Ecological park
Among the outdoor exhibition halls, the insect ecology hall is definitely popular. It can stimulate the curiosity of children by seeing and touching various insects. There are 48 themes on display, including terrestrial insects, aquatic insects, butterflies, spiders, larval breeding rooms, and insect specimen rooms.
Insect Ecology Hall (Gwacheon Science Museum)
Insects are so numerous that they account for 3/4 of all animals, and they are very diverse, enough to clear up the misconceptions that insects are just gross bugs.
'Long Life Scarab' in the Insect Ecology Center
In the Super Mill Worm experience, there are children who dig through the sandbars and pick up insects with their fingers without fear, while others look scary or frown. The appearance of enjoying varies according to personality and temperament.
Super Mill Worm Experience Center (Insect Ecology Center)
It is a great experience for children who cannot see live insects in the dark city space. The corner where you can listen to the cries of cicada, yeochi, grasshopper, and cricket is also a favorite place for children.
Listening to insect sounds
In the Butterfly Garden, you can meet butterflies all year round. After the caterpillar spends patience, it is possible to follow the butterfly that flutters a fluttering bird, while observing the process of changing into a beautiful butterfly.
Insect Ecology Butterfly Garden
Sensation playground, run as soon as you see it ~
Now it is time to enter the indoor permanent exhibition hall. It takes about 4 hours to estimate the entire exhibition hall, such as the basic science museum, natural history museum, traditional science museum, high-tech museum, and future imagination science fiction museum.
Sensory Playground Maze (Child Exploration Experience Center)
A children's exploration experience center is perfect for families who come here with their babies. This is because it is an exhibition hall where only children under the third grade of elementary school can enter. Admission is also limited for the safety of children. The 2nd floor is full of 34 different experiences, such as 'Tilt Room' and 'Sensory Playground'.
Various experiences of the sensory playground
As there are many interesting things to see, there are cases where a child's hand is momentarily missed. Children who cry and stand at the information desk are often found. To prepare for this, there is also a space to create a child-prevention bracelet so that the child's name and guardian's contact information can be used to fill the child's wrist with a bracelet.
Missing bracelet
There is also a children's playroom right next to the experience hall. It is a great place to play safely for children under 36 months old.
1st floor playroom
Curiosity, a unique experience with horses 'Secret Way Tour'
Let's Run Park (formerly Seoul Horse Racing Park) is a family park and leisure space, perfect for a family weekend outing. In particular, after the facility was renewed last year, it has been reborn as a family culture park where adults can play with their children in the playground.
Let's Run Park Horse Sculpture
In particular, NOL LOUNGE on the first floor is composed of interesting contents so that even those who are new to the word can enjoy it. The Play Zone, where you can experience a state-of-the-art equestrian simulator, is very popular with children.
Amazing entrance
You can also enjoy picnic at Solbat Garden in front of the amazing area. On weekends, it is common to see a family relaxing with a tent or mat under the brush field. However, there are smokers near Luckyville, so it is a good idea to avoid them with children.
Secret Way Tour Bus
If you visited this place with an infant or toddler, we recommend the Pony House where horses live and the 'Secret Way Tour', a horse ecological exploration program. Tours include curiosity of race horses, which are usually restricted, which adds curiosity. Gather at Geumdongcheonma, take the Secretway tour bus, and first arrive at the horse pool. This is where swimming training is done to become a strong and fast horse. Swimming for young horses promotes development and increases muscle flexibility, and for horses, the development of cardiopulmonary function increases endurance. In Maple, you can actually hear the harsh breath of the horse ringing the pool.
Horseshoes
The horseshoe clinic, Jangjeso, shows the process of horseshoe making by real priests. "The horses change their shoes too!" Here you can also experience comparing horseshoe for racing and horseback riding. The racing horse is silver and the horse riding horse is black, so the horseshoe of the racing horse is much lighter. Horses are so large and organs are complex animals, so they cannot go to any hospital, so they go to a horse hospital. Occasionally, you can watch the actual surgical procedure at a horse hospital. Children who chattered like sparrows are also breathtaking here, looking at the treatment of horses.
Horse riding (black) and racing horse (silver) horseshoe
During the Secret Way tour, you can experience feeding directly into the Massa. In a massage station, when a horse passes by, it must be stopped, giving caution to children not to get close to the horse, and safety. When feeding a horse, spread out your palms and put a carrot between your thumb and index finger so that the horse can only eat the food.
Feeding experience
Tours are available on-site at the Let's Run Park website and at the amazing information desk. It is operated from 20 am to 10 am on weekdays, and from 11 am to 16 pm on weekends, and it is operated with 20 people every hour. At Let's Run Park, adults can watch a horse race while children who are tired of playing are asleep. You don't have to buy a bookmaker, and you can feel the excitement just by looking at the horse running.
Indoor
Travel information

Recommended travel course (same day course)

Seoul Grand Park → No.1 Skylift (or Elephant Train) to Seoul Zoo Entrance → No.2 Skylift Zoo normal → Go to Seoul Zoo → Children's Zoo → Theme Garden → Giraffe Country


Recommended travel course (2 nights 3 days course)

first day : Seoul Grand Park → Seoul Zoo → Lunch → Children's Zoo → Theme Garden → Giraffe Country
Second day : National Gwacheon Science Museum (Insect Ecology Hall, Outdoor Exhibition Hall and Permanent Exhibition Hall) → Let's Run Park Seoul (Amazing Lounge, Horse Museum, Solbat Garden) → Secret Way Tour
third day : Seoul Land → National Museum of Contemporary Art, Gwacheon (Children's Museum)


question
-Gwacheon Culture and Sports Section Inquiry 02-3677-2470 / http://gccity.go.kr/tour/main.do

-Seoul Grand Park Inquiry 02-500-7335 / 102, Grand Park Plaza, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do / http://grandpark.seoul.go.kr/main.do

-Inquiry of Gwacheon Seoul Land 02-509-6000 / 181, Gwangmyeong-ro, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do / http://www.seoulland.co.kr/

-Let's Run Park Seoul Inquiries 1566-3333 / 107, Gyeongma Park-daero, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do / http://park.kra.co.kr/seoul_main.do

-National Gwacheon Science Museum Inquiry 02-3677-1500 / 110, Sanghabeol-ro, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do / http://www.sciencecenter.go.kr/

-National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art 02-2188-6000 / 313 Gwangmyeong-ro, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do / http://www.mmca.go.kr/

-Giraffe Country 02-503-1900 / 80, Grand Park Plaza, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do / http://gilinnara.co.kr/renew/index.php


Barrier-free information


-Seoul Grand Park Zoo
* Admission fee: 5,000 won for adults (19-64 years old), 3,000 won for teenagers (13-18 years old), 2,000 won for children (6-12 years old) / free for children under 5, free for children over 65
Holders of Dadong Happiness Card (citizens of Seoul) apply a 30% discount to Seoul Grand Park Zoo and Theme Garden
* Hours of use Summer (March-October) 09: 00-19: 00, Winter season (November-February) 09: 00-18: 00
* Open year round
* Stroller: Paid rental (daily fee 3,000 won, twin stroller 5,000 won)


-National Gwacheon Science Museum
* Fee: Adult (20 ~ 64 years old): 4000 won / Youth & Child (7 ~ 19 years old): 2000 won
* Hours: 09: 30 ~ 17: 30 (admission is allowed 1 hour before the end of the viewing time)
* Closed: January 1, every Monday (however, if Monday is a public holiday, the first weekday after the public holiday), the day of the holiday
* Stroller: Free stroller rental available (1st floor, 36 months or less, 50 cars)
* Nursing room: Nursing room / emergency room available (1st floor)
* Preschool playroom (available for less than 36 months)
* Food courts (Japanese, noodles, Korean, Western), cafes, and convenience stores in permanent exhibition halls


-Let's Run Park Seoul
* Admission: 2,000 won on light-mile (Friday, Saturday, Sunday), non-light-mile: free
* There is a nursing room (equipped with microwave, diaper changing bed, and baby bed)
* Medical office, missing child care room, stroller and wheelchair rental available
*...

Operating Hours: 11: 00-18: 00
* Parking Fee: (Sat ~ Sun): Pay (12,000 won per day, prepayment) / (Mon ~ Fri): Free
* Secret Way Tour
· Homepage reservation and on-site reception (surprise information desk)
· Application: No individual / group restrictions
· Number of people: 20 per time
Tour time: About 1 hour
Inquiries (02-509-1101)
Participation fee: 5,000 won per person (free for under 24 months, same as children and adults)


-Giraffe
* Fee: Children: 18,000 won, Adults 9,000 won (Admission after 14:00. Afternoon ticket release on site: Children: 13,000 won, Adults: 7,000 won)
* There is a nursing room on the second floor
* Operating Hours: Weekdays 10: 00 ~ 17: 00 (weekends ~ 18: 00), ticket closing 16:00 (weekends ~ 17: 00)

Move information

Public transportation information
-Seoul Grand Park
[Subway] Get off at Daepark Station (Line 4), exit 2
-National Gwacheon Science Museum
[Subway] Line 4, just in front of Exit 6 of Grand Park Station / Exit 5 of Horse Racing Park Station (about 10 minutes on foot)


Self-driving information
-Sadang Station → Enter the underpass in the direction of Suwon → After entering the underpass, enter the elevated road in the direction of the Grand Park → Turn right at the intersection of the Grand Park Station (Subway Line 4) → Enter the parking lot of Seoul Grand Park

Food and lodging information

Rooms
-Hotel Grace View : 2, Byeolyangsangga-ro, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do / 02-504-6700 / http://hotelgrace6700.tnaru.net/
-Seoul Grand Park Campground : 359 Makgye-dong, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do (behind National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art) / 02-502-3836 / Capacity for 1,500 people per day / Shops, showers, catering / Tent rentals for 4 people 15,000 won / Every 15th at 2 pm on the homepage Reservation for use is possible


Restaurants near
-Bonsuwon Ribs Gwacheon : Galbitang, raw ribs / 5, Hyangnamu-ro, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do / 02-502-8434
-Cauldron Hall : Gomtang, Gomtang, Suyuk / 161, Gwacheon-daero, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do 02-503-3377
-Lee Un-jung Garden : Hanjeongsik, ssambap set meal / 44, Gailo, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do 02 / 502-0909


※ The above information was updated in May 2019, and may be changed later, so please check before you travel.

item.title: Gwacheon museum trip with a light heart - Korea Match
item.description:
Chusa Museum

Gwacheon museum trip with a light heart

Korea Match

In Gwacheon, which is connected to Yangjae-dong in Seoul, there are many museums with experiences. Master Chusa is a Chusa museum where you can meet Kim Jeong-hee's life and calligraphy works. It is excellent as an experiential learning center because you can listen to the explanations of the cultural commentators and experience calligraphy. There is also the National Gwacheon Science Museum where you can learn the principles of science and experience with your body.

The name Chusa Kim Jeong-hee (1786 ~ 1856) is widely known so that no one knows it, but his life is overshadowed by a large family called “chussa”. In addition to the basic typeface of calligraphy, such as calligraphy, Jeonseo, Chaseo, Haeseo, and Haeseo, especially Chusa is Kim Jung-hee's font. It is a typeface that feels like a picture because the strokes of different thickness and the letters that seem to be distorted are unprecedented.
Chusa became a name for the Qing Dynasty in exchange for Geumseokhak and left numerous calligraphy works while interacting with literary and monks of his day. That's why you can find a lot of letters of Chusa at national sites and historical sites.

circa...
Gwajichodang restored next to Chusa Museum
The tour of the museum goes from the 1st floor where the ticket booth is located, and starts from the 2nd floor, “The Life Room of Chusa”. Chusa's portrait with impressive long eyes greets visitors first. It is a face with wrinkles around the eyes and a smile, but a strong personality and dignity.
Visitors listening to explanations from cultural commentators
Chusa's great-grandmother is Hwasun Ongju, the daughter of Yeongjo. Chusa went to a stepfather of an eldest-old father without an offspring at the age of eight. It is written in the first grade of elementary school. The letter that the father and younger brothers say hello to the letter that was written again and again.
Letter to father when Chusa was 8 years old
As a disciple of Pakje, the master of the North Korean school, the process of opening his eyes to Geumseokhak, accompanied by his father's serenity, is also introduced in detail.
Visitors hearing explanation of King Jinsung defend
While staying in Yanqing, he was influenced by the ties of priests such as Ongbanggang and Wanwon, which were regarded as masters of Geumseokhak. Afterwards, Chusa was devoted to Geumseokhak, revealing that the monument of Bukhansan, which was known to be founded by Ambassador Muhak, is a royal palace of Jinheung in the Silla period.
The part that marked the promotion of King Sunsoo

Afterwards, he went on to official office and served as the ambassador of Sungkyunkwan Gwan. In 1840, he was implicated in the prison of Yoon Sang-do and went to exile. It is known that the Chusa was completed during the 8-year exile in Jeju.

Seogwipo Distribution Media Model
Next to the model of the exile in Seogwipo, there is a long line of <Sehando>, which is also included in textbooks. The story that <Sehando> was drawn on is also special. <Sehan Do> is a gift to Lee, an ideal student who was a student during the exile in Jeju. The ideal is an interpreter who came and went to the Qing Dynasty, and was unable to escape from the exile. Chusa wrote the phrase “Sehan Yeon-fuji Song Baekji-jojo (나오는 然後 知 松柏 之後 凋)” in “The Korean Language”, putting an eye on the ideal mind that sends a difficult-to-get book to himself. It means that it is only in winter that pine trees and pine trees do not wither. It is a pictorial representation that thanks to a difficult situation, I came to appreciate it.
Ideally sent by the Qing Dynasty
In <Sehando>, there is a house without any decoration and two pine trees stand beside it. It is an explanation that among them, the unprecedented standing pine tree is ideal, and the old pine tree that seems to rely on the tree expresses Chusa himself.
<Sehando>, as we know it, is a picture, but in fact, long prestigious lines continue to the side of <Sehando>, which are several meters in length. The ideal, which received <Sehando> as a gift, was shown to people of the Qing Dynasty, and those who saw the painting wrote the impression.
<Sehan Do> and the prestigious Chinese

Another exhibit that catches the eye in the exhibition room is the lump from Bongeunsa Temple. It is a shorthand written 'Panjeon (板 展)', which is a reproduction of Jang Kyung-gak of Bongeunsa Temple in Gangnam-gu, Seoul. Invisible in Chusa's writing, it seems to be written by a beginner who has just started learning calligraphy. What is the reason why you can't see any trick or fashion and feel pure? The seven letters on the left side wash away the curiosity. “The Seventy-Old Water Squad (七十 一 壽 病 中 作)”. Chusa, meaning “write in the age of seventy years old,” wrote two letters of “convenience,” and died four days later. He was willing to sit up and hold a brush with his body facing death.
At the end of the exhibition room, there is a space where you can watch the video of Chusa's life and work, and sit back and take a moment to re-examine Chusa's life.

Bongeunsa Temple Edition Reprint
When you leave the exhibition room, you can listen to the description of the cultural commentator, as it is also interesting to see the <Bulyesunrando> engraved on the wall of the museum.
<Fireland Road> carved on the wall of the museum
In the experience room on the first floor of the basement, you can watch computer monitors, write along the words of Chusa, play Nanchi, and experience <Taehan Do> and <Bul Yi Sunran>. There is also a space exhibiting artifacts donated by Chikashi Fujitsuka, a Chusa researcher.
Takbon Experience
The Gwajichodang, which was restored outside the museum, was a villa that stayed for four years before Chusa passed away. Many of Chusa's works are said to have been used here.
<Sehan-do> and <Bul-gi-ran-ran-do>
The Chusa Museum offers a variety of experience programs under the theme of “Respond to Chusa Kim Jung-hee” for winter break, so it is recommended to visit and visit the website in advance.
Fujitsuka donation room
The National Gwacheon Science Museum is close to the Chusa Museum. This is a science experience space where you can feel and learn with your body and enjoy it not only for children but also for adults.
National Gwacheon Science Museum
There are space worlds, astronomical projection halls, and insect ecology halls, and special experiences are held in the main hall of the science museum.
Gyroscope experience to experience zero gravity
You need to get an experience ticket using the on-site ticketing system at 9:30 AM and 3:00 PM, which is popular enough to hurry on weekends and holidays.
Typhoon experience wearing raincoat
The Korean Camera Museum was located at the base of the National Gwacheon Science Museum.
Korea Camera Museum
It is the largest camera-specialized museum in Korea that houses about 15,000 camera devices, including 3,000 cameras, 6,000 lenses, and various accessories that came out of the world from 1839 to 2000 when the camera first appeared.
Exhibition Hall inside the Korea Camera Museum
From a rare camera with a trigger when the trigger is pulled to a camera from 1909 made of teak wood, and the evolution of a Leica camera that became the prototype of the camera, this is a must-see for photographers.
A camera made on a forearm
There is also a gallery where you can see the works of photographer Kim Jong-se, the owner and director of all cameras displayed in the museum.
Gallery where you can see photos
Travel information

Chusa Museum
Address: 78 Chusa-ro, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do
Contact: 02-2150-3650, www.chusamuseum.go.kr

National Gwacheon Science Museum
Address: 110 Sanghabeol-ro, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do
Contact: 02-3677-1500, www.sciencecenter.go.kr

Korea Camera Museum
Address: 8 Grand Park Gwangjang-ro, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do
Contact: 02-502-4123, www.kcpm.or.kr

1.Access

* Self-driving

Gyeongbu Expressway Yangjae IC → toward Gwacheon → Costco Intersection → turn left toward Juam-dong → Chusa-ro → Chusa Museum

* public transport

Take Subway Line 4, Sunbawi Station Exit 1, and take the general bus 11-7 or municipal bus 1 or 2 to Chusa Museum (Dongsan Church) stop
Take Exit 9 of Yangjae Station on Subway Line 3 and take the regular bus 11-7 to Chusa Museum (Dongsan Church)

2. Restaurants around

Seorabeol: Song Shabu Shabu / 2 Byeolyang Sangga-ro, Gwacheon-si / 02-502-8384

Kim Dae-gam: Barbecue, Suyuk / 30 Saetmal-ro, Gwacheon-si / 02-507-5850

Racecourse Duck House: Grilled Sulfur Duck / 20-4 Gungmal-ro, Gwacheon-si / 02-502-7500

3.Accommodation

Grace Hotel: 2, Byeolyangsangga-ro, Gwacheon-si / 02-504-6700

http://hotelgrace6700.tnaru.net/web/index

※ The above information was created in December 2013, and may change later, so be sure to check it before you travel.
※ Information, such as text, photos, and videos used in this article, is copyrighted by the Korea Tourism Organization, and unauthorized use of the article is prohibited.
